form.congress: One Hundred Seventeenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Monday, the third day of January, two thousand and twenty-two
form.official-title: To improve coordination between the Veterans Health Administration and the Veterans Benefits Administration with respect to claims for compensation arising from military sexual trauma, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the MST Claims Coordination Act.

section.header: Veterans Health Administration and Veterans Benefits Administration coordination for certain claims arising from military sexual trauma

paragraph.text: During or immediately after each covered event, and together with each covered document, in a claim for compensation arising from military sexual trauma experienced by a covered individual, the Under Secretary for Benefits of the Veterans Benefits Administration, in coordination with the Under Secretary for Health of the Veterans Health Administration, shall provide, to the covered individual—

subparagraph.text: information on the Veterans Crisis Line;
information on how to make an appointment with a mental health provider; and

other information on available resources relating to military sexual trauma (including information on military sexual trauma coordinators of the Veterans Health Administration, mental health providers trained in military sexual trauma issues, and peer support specialists).

paragraph.text: Materials described in paragraph (1) may be provided electronically.

subsection.text: In a claim for compensation arising from military sexual trauma experienced by a veteran, if the veteran is enrolled in the patient enrollment system of the Department of Veterans Affairs under section 1705 of title 38, United States Code, and consents to the notification system under this subsection, the Under Secretary for Benefits shall automatically notify the Under Secretary for Health shortly before the veteran—

paragraph.text: participates in any covered event; or

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall implement this Act not later than 18 months after the date of the enactment of this Act.

paragraph.text: The term compensation has the meaning given that term in section 101 of title 38, United States Code.
The term covered document means a determination (including a rating determination) that the Secretary of Veterans Affairs provides to the claimant in connection with a claim for compensation.
The term covered event includes, with respect to a claim for compensation—

subparagraph.text: a medical examination under section 5103A of title 38, United States Code;
a hearing before the Board of Veterans’ Appeals under section 7107 of such title; and
any other event determined relevant by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.

paragraph.text: The term covered individual means a former member of the Armed Forces (as that term is defined in section 1720D of title 38, United States Code) who elects to receive materials under subsection (a).
The term military sexual trauma has the meaning given that term in section 1166 of title 38, United States Code.
The term Veterans Crisis Line means the toll-free hotline for veterans established under section 1720F(h) of title 38, United States Code.
